title: Refused to compile or instantiate WebAssembly module because 'wasm-eval' is not an allowed source of script
body:
I try to include an Adobe xD Prototype in an Iframe in an Angular app and by doing so I receive this error:

[Report Only] 
Refused to compile or instantiate WebAssembly 
module because 'wasm-eval' is not an allowed source of script in the following Content Security Policy 
directive: 
"
script-src 
https://static.adobelogin.com/imslib/imslib.min.js 
https://prod.adobeccstatic.com/ 

'self' 'unsafe-eval'

https://bam.nr-data.net/ 
https://api.demandbase.com/ 
https://js-agent.newrelic.com/ 
https://www.gstatic.com/recaptcha/ 
https://c.evidon.com/geo/country.js 
https://assets.adobedtm.com/ 
https://use.typekit.net/ 
https://www.google.com/recaptcha/api.js 
https://*.adobe.com 
https://*.cookielaw.org/ 
https://*.onetrust.com/ 'nonce-a5e5d635-4062-43de-b73a-04a9599d3d1a'
".

I don't even have created a content policy so far. The error appears as soon as I include the src-link:

<iframe 
  src="https://xd.adobe.com/embed/9e081b15-b13d-4217-4cf9-8838d58e1ce9-e839/">
</iframe>

How could I solve it? Is it related to content security policies?

You can also check out the error if you open this Stackblitz app and inspect the preview with the browser development tools.
